So yeah, the download process could be better but it will eventually happen. It took several frustrating hours to get it to work. Once you're in the game it's a solid 5 star experience!! It's disgaea on my phone!! I'm glad I'm glad I got it.
Classic Disgaea- Now even better!
I like the game. i am waiting for other in series to be on app store!!! I cant wait!!!

Phenomenal port of the Switch version. The added Cheat Shop and Auto with 8x speed is a life changer for grinding. In 19 hours I have 3 Super Robo Suits Lv.100 and a Yoshitsuna Lv.100. I also have all content cleared and unlocked and I have transmigrated 19,998 levels for Laharl. It's absurd how much it helps. ! No issues with download or the game running. Touch controls are a WIP but good overall. Fast travel is great. DISGAEA 5 COMPLETE! MAKE IT NEXT FOR PHONES PLEASE! WITH AUTO AND 8X SPEED!
This game is awesome!

Disgaea 1 is a great game in its own, but damn this version improves in almost everthing, cutting the tedious parts and making awesome quality of life improvements, and graphics changes to an awesome game. Only problem that i had was downloading the game, but that asides it's just great!

Absolute classic. I played the hell out of it, literally maxing out every char, story and generic. I now have 32 chars with 210 bonus points allocated. If you know what that means then you understand disgaea! Auto battle and repeat battle add a whole extra dimension to the game play. It's also a jrpg management game now! Power level your minions at high speed or watch them take on the enemies themselves. Exciting times!

Terrible. A absolute nightmare to download the game once installed. Phone will auto disable the download when screen is turns off. Absolutely the biggest pain out of any game on Android in terms of download ease, or the lack of.
DISGAEA 5 COMPLETE (MOBILE) WHEN

Great port of a fantastic game, hours of fun for off-line play. Would give 5 stars but the S-Pen for my Samsung note 20 ultra does not work at all on this app. Please add touch support in future :) EDIT: Touch support added! Looking forward to future releases of the series~
Need hint for controllers. My muscle memory doesn't work after 17 years. Menus/quick travel button should adapt 21:9 or other aspect ratio phone screen.

Cant even download. Ive got like 500mbs left and it crashes every time. Edit Dec 16th: still trying to download but crashes everytime. Do not waste your money, these people dont care about you enough to fix their own program.
Could not play.. loaded up to choose language with no options just blank screen
Would like to rate this game but can't even pick a language if the creator of this game dont respond and help me fix this i will do a refund
Despite being available on Chromebook, it ran with a constant flicker on my Pixelbook Go. I adjusted settings but it remains unplayable.
Love the game, just not much to do after you beat it and collect all the items since there isn't much post game content for the first game. Do y'all plan on making a complete version of disgaea 2?
Simply amazing

Disgaea 1 INcomplete No access to Plenair which was offered in the Nintendo DS edition. Therefore, this game is INCOMPLETE until Plenair is unlocked for FREE (under the original req. of being in New Game + and open Assembly)
So far, i not had a good impression. The install is way too l9ng and what kind of price is this? Dragon quest 8 is better and its half this price
I loved the game as a kid and it's highly improved on mobile.

A really good console quality port for mobile. It outclassed the original ps2 version that I played so the price tag is a deal for portability. People who complain about the price must have not seen console game prices. I wish Nipponichi continues to port disgaea series and their other franchise gems like La Pucelle: Tactics, Makai kingdom, Phantom Brave, and Soul Nomad. I would love to buy them all to play on the go.

So I'm giving this game a low score not because I haven't tried it it's just that every time I go on the app and try to play the game it would load up to 40/50 or 60 percent than it would crash but I still have big hopes that the game will do good so I would like a refund to purchase a different game or waite for this bug to be fixed

Google doesn't give enough characters to rate this game. I never played Disgaea 1; only the second one and I was in love. I poured over a thousand hours into one of my games. Disgaea 1 works great on the phone; the only downside to converting to mobile is that touch can be tricky especially since you have to double tap. Maybe suggest single tap? The story is amazing (of course it is!) and I love the fast forward button; it makes the grindy bits much less burdensome. Great job; worth the money!
The game freezes on the select language screen. I sent email to support and got no response. Wasted $32
replyContent: We apologize for the inconvenience. We will get back to you from customer support. Please check and reply.

content: Best ever
well dome with the x8 speed and auto, looking for the disgaea 2 with speed and auto
Hey this is a really good port. Please port Disgaea 2! üëçüôè
It's better than the PC version. This is the way to play it. The controls are fine in my opinion. The graphics are just amazing. It's worth the money if you like this type of game.

Well, if the devs ever get around to actually updating this game beyond its release window, SPen support is very-much needed. So yeah, If you're gonna charge $30 on Android, actual support is expected. Now who wants to guess whether or not we'll ever here from these devs again after they abandoned this expensive game on the Play Store a month after release.

I absolutely love this version of Disgaea! The graphics are updated and the auto-battle and battle speed settings are welcome additions. Being able to auto-play levels is a useful way to quickly grind early levels. My one complaint is input. The controls are absolutely awful. In order to select a character, you need to double tap on them, which is incredibly difficult on a small display screen. Scrolling and zooming in and out are awkward - even more so than in the original PS2 game. The option to have an on-screen controller would have fixed many of these problems. It does support PS3 controllers, but that's not ideal for cell phones. Control issues aside, I still think this is the best version of the game. Auto battle is a strong selling point in a game that requires constant grinding. Highly recommended.

Why no Fifth star: Con: Lack on-screen joypad UI, as well as bluetooth joypad support, easy to miss-tap. Unlock Plenair only after beating the whole game, not the Midboss ending, go to assembly and 1000 mana. Pro: else simiar to Switch version. Graphics are great.
Nice game but sometime the control is abit hard

This is the best way to play Disgaea 1. Updated character models and all of the QOL improvements of Disgaea 5. Its a bit difficult to get used to on the phone but it only takes a few hours before you are just as fast as you were with the controller. There seems to be a minor problem with the audio on the Galaxy s7 but its not game breaking. Every once in a while after using certain skills it makes an obnoxious buzz. It only lasts about a half a second though. I'm still giving it 5 stars!
Love this game, used to play on DS. Can someone tell me how to unlock pleinair on this version?
Good port, plays well.
Pretty great port. Now if they would just release the other Disgaea games and maybe Makai Kingdom, Rhapsody: A musical adventure or La Pucelle tactics on Android/iOS. :D

Reminds me of the original! It brought back a lot of fond memories. The controls are a little wacky but once you get use to them they are OK. It adds some extra features like autobattle so you can skip all of the monotonous grinding. I like fights and challenges but my least favorite part of any rpg is grinding if I have to repeat the same level multiple times just to build up and move to the next then it gets boring for me. I like a challange not a grind. And this game will let you skip that!
Paid 32$ for the full game and its not the full game I want my money back üò§

content: I've loved this game since it's PS2 days. The touch controls may be a little wonky at times on my phone but the quality of life improvements like auto battle and 8x speed more than make up for it. I'm really hoping that they release the other games in the series this way on mobile as I prefer this sort of grind to all the gacha free to play schemes out there. Definitely worth the price dood!
I'm new to the series, this game is funny, beatiful and weird. Is there any chance Disgaea 2 mobile will release one of these days too?

Very very good port. My only complaint is the controls could be a bit more streamlined in my opinion, my had gets cramped after playing for a while with the current format. Hopefully that could get fixed later on. Another issue is even if you have the volume settings at zero, the main menu still plays music, it would be nice if the game would sync the in game files setting with the menu. Other than that it is a fantastic port!
Its disgaea buy it
Great Port. Hours of entertainment.
The game crashes constantly on note 8. Every other item world end in a crash to desktop . Would be great otherwise .

Amazing port of Disgaea 1. Welcome quality of life improvements. Auto battle and 8x speed significantly cut down on the endgame grinding time. The cheat shop addition is very useful as well. The price is worth what you get - a complete game with NO microtransactions. Thank you NIS for being one of the few honest gaming companies with player interest in mind. I hope you have plans to make Disgaea 2 thru 5 mobile as well.
Game doesn't work, Opens and instantly closes. Disappointed.

Multiplayer system: 1v1 2v2 2 player adventure in item world Guild system (guild contribution, guild contribution, etc..) 2. Auto farming system: Has a setting for support classes (auto heal, espoir, etc..) Has a setting for auto basic attack only 3. Character skins (pls pls pls) Headwears, color skins, back items, voices, etc.. 4.Bringing back the passive skillof each characters
The autobattle aspect really takes the grind out of the late game without making it too easy. Really good improvement over the original game.

content: Great game however I am surprised it is just a port of the original not have the sequel (d2) built in or have more add ons I would pay for chapter bundles of any of the other disgaea games
This is the better version because of Auto Battle (best feature ever) and Cheat shop

Enjoyed it for a while before some gamebreaking bugs occurred. Two of my characters turned into "data shop" after item world without my noticing. Etna was one of them. I tried deleting the characters and finishing the game to try and reboot Etna but she is permanently gone. I put too many hours to started a game fresh.

I've always loved this game. Being able to play it years later is a welcomed experience, overflowing with nostalgia. The new features are great. The only gripe I have comes with auto-combat. While it is great most of the time, the AI for healers could be better. What else do they need that SP for? Sling a heal at your boy, once in a while. Still, 5 stars.

I LOVE this game ever since I played it first in my psp when I was in high school when I first saw it here in the app store i immediately bought it and already played 30 hrs of it thanks nippon ichi software hope you port disgaea 2, phantom brave, z.h.p, prinny or prinny 2 hope to see more of the old I.P be ported

content: A great game. It can be overwhelming at first, but it's easily enjoyable nonetheless throughout its 40+ hours of main content. Engaging tactical gameplay, beautiful graphics and music and lots of content.

Disgaea is one of the best games. Have it for every system and happy to see it for mobile. Bought right away not caring for the price it cost and I don't regret it one bit. The controls are a bit to getting used to but yea lol. GET IT!!!

Love this game. I've been playing for a few days, but hit a game breaking bug. Loaded it up today, was prompted to patch and now the game has turned Japanese and I can't resolve it. Really weird. Please fix. Edit: Well, fixed it by reinstalling. Lost all my progress though so not too chuffed. Game is an easy 5 stars but if it happens again, I'm out.

Finally I have been waiting for a Disgaea game for mobile! I had this on my PSP years ago and I have missed playing this game. Everything is great on this port, especially the new sprites. My only gripe is that auto battle crashes after a certain period of time. Thankfully there is an autosave feature after a battle so nothing is lost.

Had it on the PS2... Then on the DS.... Now on Mobile! Great time waster. The humor is always good. The play is easy. If you like Tactics games then this is for you!
Finally got this game to download. Kept getting stuck on download screen. Anyone having same issue just close the app completely and open again it will continue downloading from where it froze.

Looks really well made not a cheap remade game like many developer are doing atm .but really will like to have cross play true platforms like android and switch hopefully will get it and if crossplay is available de auto play disable if not will by unfair. But rest really well made old good game .

Hey for anyone who is interested in this game, please click into ur google play app and make sure it's up to date, this will make the game downloading alot faster and it will fully dowload without any problems
So far it works and its good to get back into it.

Playing this on a Galaxy S7 and it runs pretty good. However, I believe 60 FPS overheats my phone, so switching to 30 FPS will have to do. The Graphics are sooo beautiful compared to the original. It has Cloud Saving as well. It has an auto battle and x8 speed feature. (I'll try not to use those for a better experience) Overall, I'm enjoying this game and it's worth every penny.
Awesome port, with good touch ui. Unfortunately keeps crashing at random in item world on my S9.

I'm a long time Disgaea fan since the PSP days and I just couldn't let this game go by without getting it. The download was fast. The game runs and plays smoothly. The controls feel really awkward but I can get use to it. The new Auto Battle cuts some of the long and tediuos grinding. The premium price is definitely worth it. It's Disgaea on mobile. What more do you want? It's the best SRPG out there.

I love this game. Great gameplay and fun graphics, the sprites are high quality and full of soul. NIS, the makers of this game, are one of the best game companies in the world. Their games are gems, each one with something good to offer. Disgaea games could be said to be their Master Gem, easily the best Tactical RPG series in existence with great amounts of content ranging from the Item World to the postgame and more. You won't get out of something to do in this game for a long time. Trust it.

I was excited to try Disgaea on mobile as a long time fan. It downloaded without issue but it kept flickering throughout the process. Once the game loaded, things only got worse graphically. Glitch effects akin to Pokemon's missingno appeared in the upper right fourth of the screen rendering it impossible to see. The game launched and the intro's subs wouldn't show correctly. Once I was in the game, effect spread to the entire upper half of the screen. Hope it gets fixed soon. Device has 3gb RAM
Really solid remaster for mobile. The interface was redone and everything plays well. I hope they bring over other Disgaea titles as well.
I've bin waiting forever for this to come on the phone!!

I wanted this game on mobile for a while. It works great for the mobile platform and I couldn't be happier. (Actually, I could, if you release the other Disgaea games so we can play them, too! Would you think about doing this sometime in the future? Pretty please!)

I was worried about whether I would resent this game solely based on the $$$ I spent on it, especially because I've never played disgaea before. Other than jank movement and camera rotation controls in battle, this game is an absolute addictive blast to play. It is an amazing game in its aesthetics and game play and should not be missed by JRPG fans and strategy game fans alike.

This is probably the best mobile port of a console game I've seen on android. The game itself already works well as a mobile game, and the developers even added some quality of life improvements like battle speed controls and auto battle. The price is high for a mobile game, but the quality of the game justifies the price. Think about how much you would have to spend on the average "free to play" game to get the level of enjoyment you get out of this one purchase.
Stuck at 24mb left to download. I will update review when/if this is fixed. Once it finally downloaded, the game is fun. The auto play is a nice feature.

content: Game has crashed and won't start back up

Edit: While I initially had problems with the data download, the patch update appears to have fixed the issue. ^^ I was able to play the game, finally. For someone who has played Disgaea (pretty much every port except Disgaea DS), this version of the game seems incredibly solid. While the concept of auto battle mode sounds weird for someone who spent hundreds of hours grinding levels, to me it is a godsend. This app is for those who love Disgaea, yet can't spend too much time on it. Thank you.

Update released to help download stability. I was able to get it working this time, so thank you! It's an awesome game, and my favorite srpg series. Tons of character customization, silly dialogue, and fun combat. The controls for mobile work really well, though they may take some practice to get the hang of them. Thank you!

As of the newest patch I have to thank the developers for fixing the download stability issue Right now this game crashes before I can finish downloading the last bit of the final file. I have no idea how it pays. I'm playing on a Sony xperia. Please fix the download / patch installer.

Using Galaxy S8, and I haven't experienced any of the problems mentioned in other reviews. No crashing, and cloud save is working for me. I have everything on the highest settings, and other than some audio clipping common on emulation, there are no issues for me. As far as the port goes, I own several games ported to mobile and this is probably the best done. UI is great other than a little annoyance with the camera movement. I hope they keep porting this series as technology allows for it.

content: High Quality +1 OVERLORD!
Expensive but worth it for disgaea lovers. Touch controls are slow to use but the auto-fight feature is awesome.

A great port of a great game. Partial controller support, cloud saves & all DLC from the previous versions of the game. Take a note, Square Enix. This is a mobile port done right. Until they make this on PC, this is the best version of game to get. Yes, $33 can be a big ask, but considering Nintendo Switch version is $50 and runs at a lower resolution & frame rate, this is a deal. Wish cloud saves just used GPS instead of password. If you don't have a Switch & want this game on the go, get it.

It's Disgaea 1 but with a touch interface. I do have a little difficulty touching the exact spot to select some items, but it's not enough of a problem to hinder my enjoyment of the game. I'm using a Pixel 3 and did not have any trouble downloading the game over wifi. Hopefully they'll soon resolve the download issues others are experiencing. $32 is a lot of money to waste on a never ending download.

content: It's fun. The auto battle is a nice addition for the phone. A suggestion is to allow for different AI choices for different characters, for example ninja strictly physically attacks without using skills and mage uses lowest attack spell using one tile from furthest away. For controls, sometimes it is difficult to select a character. I have yet to try a Bluetooth controller.

First off, it works for me on my Samsung Galaxy Tab S3. Second, it is basically the complete Disgaea game that was originally released on Playstation2, with some added upgrades. The controls can be a bit annoying at time (mainly camera rotation), but the fact that you can play this entire game as a mobile app is awesome. The price is steep, but considering the quality of game, it is probably worth it (if you like turn based tactical RPG's like final fantasy tactics or, well, Disgaea).

content: I been asking for this for a while in all the survey's. First off thank you. Second its basically disgaea 1 with a few upgrades like auto battle and super speed. content: Outstanding port of an outstanding game. Runs great on the MOQI I7S. Please port the others. :D

I've been hoping for a Disgaea game on mobile for years. The price may seem high, but it is well worth it, and a lot less than most people end up spending on "free" mobile games. Here, you'll get a full console experience, with an insane amount of content.
